Header:
High-plex imaging is becoming an increasingly valuable tool to study the tumor microenvironment (TME) in immuno-oncology. Imaging Mass Cytometry™(IMC™) enables the visualization and analysis of the complex spatial biology of the TME. IMC permits detailed assessment of cell phenotype and function using 40-plus markers simultaneously at subcellular resolution on a single slide without spectral overlap or autofluorescence. The ability to analyze multiple markers can facilitate accurate prediction of disease progression and clinical outcome measures from precious tissue samples and microarrays. Here, we demonstrate how our reagents and technology support these applications.

High-plex antibody panels targeting T cells, natural killer cells, myeloid cells, immune checkpoint markers, epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and extracellular matrix (ECM) proteins were used to study the immune microenvironment in multiple cancer histologies. We used the Maxpar® Human Immuno-Oncology IMC Panel Kit as a base panel that was expanded to create the desired panel for each tissue.

Waypoints.Name: Myeloid cell infiltration in skin melanoma
Waypoints.Description: IMC staining of melanoma from skin shows presence of strong signal for myeloid cells (CD14, CD11c, HLA-DR) in the tumor area (vimentin). CD11c and HLA-DR co-localization appears as yellow.

Waypoints.Name: Myeloid cell infiltration in skin melanoma #2
Waypoints.Description: IMC staining of melanoma from skin shows presence of strong signal for myeloid cells (CD14, CD11c, HLA-DR) in the tumor area (vimentin). Ki-67 staining shows active proliferation in the tumor tissue.

Waypoints.Name: Myeloid cell infiltration in skin melanoma #3
Waypoints.Description: IMC staining of melanoma from skin shows presence of strong signal for myeloid cells (CD14, CD11c, HLA-DR) in the tumor area (vimentin), together with other immune markers.

Waypoints.Name: Lymphocyte Subsets and Tumor
Waypoints.Description:
You can visualize T cell subsets and B cells across this section of skin melanoma. 
Notice how CD4 and CD8 cell signal does not overlap and how even rare B cells (in pink) can be identified with CD20

Waypoints.Name: Cell segmentation kit
Waypoints.Description:
Any high-plex imaging analysis starts with cell segmentation. You can now segment with confidence using the IMC Cell Segmentation Kit*.

Our proprietary IMC Cell Segmentation Kit includes three individual plasma membrane markers for improved nucleus and plasma membrane demarcation.

Notice how by using this kit 100% of all cells are stained with our cell segmentation markers, allowing this to be used as a unique tool to get robust datasets.
